jobs.title: Growth Management Intern
jobs.description:
Who we are:

MindHug is an early stage mental wellbeing start-up supported and incubated by UCL Innovation and Enterprise.

We believe that mental health is an important and often overlooked aspect of overall health. We envision creating a platform for people to have more choice in activities and better ownership over their mental health and wellbeing i.e. think meditation, pet therapy, etc. We want to offer greater choice, credibility and engagement as well as provide the tools and data to help individuals find what works best for them. 

We are currently a small team and looking to grow the team as we develop our MVP and have a number of events in the pipeline. 

Where are we:

We are part of the Hatchery, UCL’s accelerator program and work at their co-working space, BaseKX - set in vibrant and innovation friendly Kings Cross, moments away from Regents Canal, Granary Square and Google. The Hatchery is a programme designed to support the most promising entrepreneurs and startups.

The Role:

As anyone working in a startup will tell you - everyone wears multiple hats multiple times a day! Flexibility is therefore key that also means there is never a dull moment. You will be working closely with the founders and among other things, will be involved in:

Assisting with research, project management, business development and product development.
Getting to grips with strategy, business planning, financial modelling and fundraising.
Helping with marketing, branding and social media activities.
Assisting in event organisation.
Handling emails and queries.
Attending and minuting meetings.
Filling in for the work of the CEO and Chief Medical Officer when needed.

The Ideal Candidate:

Essential 

We are looking for an enthusiastic, creative, eager to learn, and driven individuals to join us on a full-time/part-time/flexible basis. We want the right person and are flexible about how this person works. Good interpersonal and communication skills, an interest in innovation and a passion for mental wellbeing are a must.

Nice to have (but not essential!)

Knowledgeable in Technology ideally in product management, software and web development, and/or UX/UI.
Data science knowledge is a plus. 
Some experience in psychology, psychiatry and/or medical sciences.
Some exposure to GDPR, medical regulations, and NHS and NICE guidelines.
Some knowledge of marketing channels and social media advertising.
Previous work in a startup will be looked at favourably.  
MindHug is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage qualified applications from individuals with a wide array of backgrounds irrespective of gender, age, race, religion or belief system, sexual orientation and disability. Our people make us who we are. 

Whats on offer:

This is an incredible opportunity to join a new team, build a product and develop various skills whilst networking with other entrepreneurs - and learn all about innovation and entrepreneurship. You will gain broad experience in developing technology, business strategy, operations, as well as client facing and desk based communication. 

This is an unremunerated internship. The hope however is for this to transition into a full time position where equity will be on offer for the right candidate. 

If this internship ticks the boxes for you, we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Creative Director and UX/UI specialist (Founding Team Member)
jobs.description:
**Please note that this is a position to join the founding team as a Creative Director and UX/UI specialist. This is unremunerated (until we secure funding) and you would be rewarded with equity in the business. Part Time/Full Time/other working patterns will all be considered. **

### Who we are
MindHug is an early stage mental wellbeing start-up supported and incubated by UCL Innovation and Enterprise.

We believe that mental health is an important and often overlooked aspect of overall health. We envision creating a platform for people to have more choice in activities and better ownership over their mental health and wellbeing. Choices include experiential art therapy, music therapy, mindfulness etc. We want to offer greater choice, credibility and engagement as well as provide the tools and data to help individuals find what works best for them. 

We have made good progress in market research as well as building the brand and product outline.

We are currently a small team and looking to grow the team as we develop our MVP and have a number of events in the pipeline. Our board is made up of an innovation and risk specialist, a psychiatry registrar and an AI and sound engineering specialist. 

### Where are we
We are part of the Hatchery, UCL’s incubator program and work at their co-working space, BaseKX - set in vibrant and innovation friendly Kings Cross, moments away from Regents Canal, Granary Square and Google. The Hatchery is a programme designed to support the most promising entrepreneurs and startups.

### The Role
This person will be an experienced and enthusiastic UI / UX Designer who is ready to get stuck in and help develop our MVP both visually and with the user experience. As a Creative Director, you would also ideally have creative skills in video recording, photo and video editing. Exposure in VR/AR and immersive media technologies will be a bonus. 

You must be an entrepreneurial thinker who understands their design decisions will impact the success of the business.

You should have a portfolio of high-quality design work and are a naturally artistic and creative thinker. 

Experience working at an early stage startup is ideal. You will be working closely with the founders and be involved in other aspects of the development. You will also work with our partnered therapists in developing digital content.  

### The Ideal Candidate

**Essential **

•	Passion in working in the mental wellbeing space
•	Able to lead a UI/UX project from research to completion
•	Experience in mobile app design (wireframing, prototyping, etc)
•	Proficiency in photo and video editing
•	Confident in using data and insights to base designs on
•	Create graphics for social marketing and business presentations
•	Produce various visual assets that convey the brand's messaging
•	Available now for a role based in London****

**Nice to have (but not essential!)**

•	Experience in product management; software, mobile and web development
•	Some experience in psychology, psychiatry and/or medical sciences.
•	Some knowledge of marketing channels and social media advertising.
•	Experience in immersive media (AR/VR)
•	Previous work in a startup will be looked at favourably. 

**MindHug is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage qualified applications from individuals with a wide array of backgrounds irrespective of gender, age, race, religion or belief system, sexual orientation and disability. Our people make us who we are. **

# Whats on offer
This is an incredible opportunity to join an established founding team, build a product and develop various skills whilst networking with other entrepreneurs - and learning all about innovation and entrepreneurship. This is an unpaid role (initially) with equity on offer.
